content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>NOAA/NESDIS/NODC/NCDDC -- National Coastal Data Development Center</origin> <pubdate>2003</pubdate> <title>National Data Buoy Center Buoy Locations</title> <geoform>vector digital data</geoform> <onlink>http://www.ncddc.noaa.gov/website/OE_BaseData/ndbc_buoys.zip</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>The Buoy table consists of location information, ownership, and general geographic descriptions of buoys and weather stations.  In addition to buoys operated by the National Data Buoy Center (including C-MAN stations and DART buoys), this data set includes those maintained by Chesapeake Biological Laboratory, University of South Florida, Center for Coastal and Land-Margin Research at Oregon Health & Science University, Environment Canada, Caro-COOPS: Carolinas Coastal Ocean Observing and Prediction System, Essi Corporation, Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory, Gulf of Maine Ocean Observing System, Coastal Studies Institute at Louisiana State University, Louisiana Universities Marine Consortium, Monterey Bay Aquarium Research Institute, University of Connecticut, Department of Marine Sciences, NC-COOS: North Carolina Coastal Ocean Observing System, Scripps Institution of Oceanography, Skidaway Institute of Oceanography, Stevens Institute of Technology, Texas A & M University, and Texas Coastal Ocean Observing Network</abstract> <purpose>The purpose of the Buoy table is to show the locations of weather stations and buoys in waters belonging to the United States and those adjacent to these waters.</purpose> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>Unknown</begdate> <enddate>Unknown</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>Unknown</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>As needed</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <native>Native format for the original data was ArcGIS 9.x shapefiles that were loaded into ArcSDE for use within NCDDC's spatial data model.</native> <progaff> <progname>National Coastal Data Development Center IMS Services</progname> </progaff> </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic>Unknown</logic> <complete>Unknown</complete> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>National Data Buoy Center</origin> <pubdate>Unknown</pubdate> <title>NDBC Buoys</title> </citeinfo> </srccite> <typesrc>Web site</typesrc> <srctime> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>Unknown</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <srccurr>Unknown</srccurr> </srctime> <srccitea>National Data Buoy Center (NDBC)</srccitea> <srccontr>Public information about each buoy listed on website</srccontr> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>Information was taken from the National Data Buoy Center's web site where the list of buoys were listed.  A Microsoft Access table was used to store the data listed on the web site for each buoy.  The location of each buoy had to be recalculated from degrees minutes seconds to decimal degrees.  The Access table was exported to a dbf file.  This file was then imported into ArcMap with the Tools-Add XY data menu option and by choosing the name of the table, confirming the x and y fields and clicking OK to continue.  The layer event is added to the map.  To convert to a shapefile then right click on the layer event, select Data-Export Data, rename the file and click OK and then Yes to add layer to map.</procdesc> <procdate>2003</procdate> <proccont> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>National Coastal Data Development Center</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype> <city>Stennis Space Center</city> <state>MS</state> <postal>39529</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>866-732-2382</cntvoice> <cntfax>228-688-2968</cntfax> <cntemail>ncddcgetdata@noaa.gov</cntemail> <hours>8am - 5pm, Monday through Friday</hours> </cntinfo> </proccont> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc>Data loaded into ArcSDE to be used within NCDDC's spatial data model.</procdesc> <procdate>2004</procdate> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc>The Buoy table within the NCDDC Data Model was updated with the latest information from the National Data Buoy Center web site.  The new shapefile was loaded into ArcSDE.</procdesc> <procdate>20050426</procdate> <proccont> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>National Coastal Data Development Center</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntaddr>
